tripInfo.title: Hong Kong Day Trip Adventure
tripInfo.subtitle: Discover the best of Hong Kong in one unforgettable day

attractions.name: Victoria Peak (The Peak)

transport.instructions: Take Peak Tram from Central. Book online to skip queues.

highlights: 360Â° panoramic views of Hong Kong skyline
attractions.description: Start your Hong Kong adventure at the most iconic viewpoint in the city. The Peak offers breathtaking panoramic views of Victoria Harbour, towering skyscrapers, and the surrounding islands.
tips: Visit early morning for best visibility
Book Peak Tram tickets online to avoid long queues
Bring a jacket - it's cooler at the top
Allow extra time for photos

attractions.name: Dim Sum Lunch in Central

transport.instructions: Take Peak Tram down, then Central MTR to Admiralty, walk to City Hall.

attractions.description: Experience Hong Kong's famous dim sum culture at one of the city's most renowned establishments. Enjoy handcrafted dumplings, buns, and tea in a traditional setting.
tips: Arrive before 12 PM for best selection
Try har gow (shrimp dumplings) and siu mai
Order Chinese tea - jasmine or pu-erh recommended
Don't be shy - point at what looks good on other tables

attractions.name: Star Ferry Crossing

location.address: Star Ferry Pier, Tsim Sha Tsui

transport.instructions: Walk to Star Ferry Pier Central, take ferry to Tsim Sha Tsui.

highlights: Most affordable way to see Victoria Harbour
attractions.description: Take the legendary Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour - one of the world's great ferry rides. This historic service offers spectacular views of both sides of the harbour at an unbeatable price.
tips: Sit on the right side for best skyline views
Keep camera ready - the crossing is short
Try both upper and lower deck experiences
Very affordable but cash only

attractions.name: Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade

transport.instructions: Step off ferry and walk directly to promenade.

highlights: Unobstructed views of Hong Kong Island skyline
Avenue of Stars honoring Hong Kong cinema
attractions.description: Stroll along one of the world's most spectacular waterfront promenades. With unobstructed views of Victoria Harbour and the Hong Kong Island skyline, this is the perfect spot for photos and relaxation.
tips: Golden hour (4-6 PM) provides best lighting
Bring water and comfortable shoes
Look for Bruce Lee statue and handprints
Save phone battery for evening light show

attractions.name: Symphony of Lights

location.address: Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade (best viewing spot)

timing.bestVisitTime: Arrive 15 minutes early for good spots

transport.instructions: Remain at promenade for evening show.

highlights: Perfect end to Hong Kong day
attractions.description: Witness the world's largest permanent light and sound show as Hong Kong's skyline comes alive with synchronized lights and music. This nightly spectacle is the perfect finale to your Hong Kong adventure.
tips: Arrive 15-20 minutes early for prime viewing spots
Bring portable phone charger for photos/videos
Show happens nightly at 8 PM sharp
Consider dinner nearby before the show
